meanings.definition: An estate of land, especially one held on condition of feudal service.
meanings.sent1: The nobleman granted his loyal knight a fiefs for his service.
meanings.sent2: In medieval times, lords often granted fiefs to vassals in exchange for military support.
meanings.sent3: The fiefs were like tiny kingdoms, each with its own rules and customs.
meanings.sent4: The fiefs were the building blocks of the feudal system, each piece contributing to the whole.
meanings.sent5: The fiefs were like puzzle pieces, fitting together to form a larger picture of the kingdom.

meanings.sent1: The king bestowed a grand fiefs upon his most trusted baron.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy merchant purchased a fiefs in the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The fiefs were like treasures to the nobles, passed down through generations.
meanings.sent4: The fiefs symbolized power and status in the feudal society.
meanings.sent5: The fiefs gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of wealth and influence.
